resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/106504</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>106504</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770206874</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">The Lost Museum</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Das Verlorene Museum</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Le Musée Perdu</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">O Museu Perdido</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Il Museo Perso</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Το χαμένο μουσείο</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">El Museo Perdido</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">explores P.T. Barnum's American Museum, which epitomized popular entertainment and education in the U.S. for nearly a quarter of a century. The museum?which also articulated major issues confronting American culture, society, and politics?was destroyed in 1865 in one of the most spectacular fires in New York City's history.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Social Sciences</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">erforscht P.T. Barnums American Museum, das 
populärer Unterhaltung und von Vertrag Ausbildung in den VEREINIGTEN 
STAATEN für fast ein Viertel eines Jahrhunderts gab. Die 
museum?which auch gegliederten Hauptausgaben, welche die amerikanische
Kultur, Gesellschaft und politics?was zerstört 1865 in einem der 
großartigsten Feuer in der Geschichte der New York Stadt 
konfrontieren.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">explore le musée d'American de P.T. Barnum's, qui
a résumé le divertissement et l'éducation populaires aux ETATS-UNIS
pour presque un quart d'un siècle. Les issues principales 
également articulées de museum?which confrontant la culture, la 
société, et les politics?was américains détruits en 1865 dans un 
des feux les plus spectaculaires dans l'histoire de la ville de New 
York.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">explora o museu de Americano de P.T. Barnum, que 
epitomized o entertainment e a instrução populares nos ESTADOS 
UNIDOS para quase um quarto de um século. As edições 
principais também articuladas do museum?which que confrontam a 
cultura, a sociedade, e politics?was americanos destruídos em 1865 em
um dos fogos os mais espectaculares no history da cidade de New York.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">esplora il museo dell'American del P.T. Barnum, 
che epitomized l'intrattenimento e la formazione popolari negli STATI 
UNITI per quasi un quarto di un secolo. Le edizioni principali 
anche articolate del museum?which che confrontano coltura, società ed
i politics?was americani distrutti in 1865 in uno dei fuochi 
più spettacolari nella storia della città de New York.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">εξερευνά P.T. το αμερικανικό μουσείο Barnum, το 
οποίο συνόψισε τη δημοφιλείς ψυχαγωγία και την εκπαίδευση στις 
ΗΠΑ για σχεδόν ένα τέταρτο ενός αιώνα. Το museum?which 
άρθρωσε επίσης σημαντικά ζητήματα που αντιμετωπίζουν τον 
αμερικανικούς πολιτισμό, την κοινωνία, και τα politics?was που 
καταστράφηκαν το 1865 σε μια από τις πιό θεαματικές πυρκαγιές 
στην ιστορία της πόλης της Νέας Υόρκης.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">explora el museo american de P.T. Barnum, que 
personificó la hospitalidad y la educación populares en los ESTADOS 
UNIDOS para casi un cuarto de un siglo. Las ediciones 
principales también articuladas del museum?which que enfrentan la 
cultura, la sociedad, y politics?was americanos destruidos en 1865 en 
uno de los fuegos más espectaculares de la historia de la ciudad de 
Nueva York.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Sozialwissenschaften</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Les Sciences Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ciências Sociais</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Scienze Sociali</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Κοινωνικές επιστήμες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Ciencias Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770206874</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Custom License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>106504</entry>
    </identifier>
    <name>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/courses/the-lost-museum</uri>
      </location>
    </item>
  </manifestation>
</expression>
